Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of faded added bands; exterior, from top; broken maeander band between dilute bands; below, two wide bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The curvature of the bowl suggests that the sherd comes from a relatively large chalice. The concentric brown bands are typical of the Animal Chalice, Grand and Chalice Styles, but the lack of interior decoration is most similar to the Chalice Style, which has less interior decoration in chalices than the other two styles.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0684) (phase 2)
